suncertify.db
Class Contractor

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.Contractor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Contractor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is used to represent a database contractor record. I can hold all the field data in the record and be used to extract individual field data or a String[] holding the database record field data. I can also hold a record marked for deletion if needed.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Black
See Also:
Serialized Form

private  int flag
          Stores the flag field of the contractor record.
static int FLAG_FIELD_LENGTH
          The size of the field for containing the flag to indicate whether the record is marked deleted or valid.
private  java.lang.String location
          Stores the location field of the contractor record as a single String containing the location of the contractor.

          The size of the Location field for the contractor.

          The size of the Owner field for the contractor.

          Stores the specialties field of the contractor record as a single String containing a comma separated list of speciality services that the contractor can offer.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RECORD_LENGTH

public static final int RECORD_LENGTH
The size of a complete record in the database. Calculated by adding all the previous fields together. Knowing this makes it easy to work with an entire block of data at a time (rather than reading individual fields), reducing the time needed to block on database access.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

flag

private int flag
Stores the flag field of the contractor record.

name

private java.lang.String name
Stores the name field of the contractor record as a single short containing first and last name.

location

private java.lang.String location
Stores the location field of the contractor record as a single String containing the location of the contractor.

specialties

private java.lang.String specialties
Stores the specialties field of the contractor record as a single String containing a comma separated list of speciality services that the contractor can offer.

size

private java.lang.String size
Stores the size field of the contractor record as a single String containing the number of employees the contractor has.

rate

private java.lang.String rate
Stores the rate field of the contractor record as a single String containing the charge of the contractor including the currency symbol.

owner

private java.lang.String owner
Stores the owner field of the contractor record as a single String containing the 8 digit customer id number. The contractor is considered booked if customer id is present.

                  java.lang.String location,
                  java.lang.String specialties,
                  java.lang.String size,
                  java.lang.String rate,
                  java.lang.String owner)
Creates an instance of this object with a specified list of initial values. Assumes that the record is not deleted.

Parameters:
name - holds the name of the contractor.
location - holds the location of the contractor.
specialties - holds the specialties of the contractor.
size - holds the number of employees of the contractor.
rate - holds the hourly rate of the contractor.
owner - holds the 8 digit customer id if booked.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object aContractor)
Checks whether two Contractor objects are the same by comparing their name and location. Since combination of the name and location is considered the unique primary key for every Contractor, if the two name and location combinations are the same, the two Contractor records must be the same record.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
aContractor - the Contractor to compare with this Contractor
Returns:
true if this Contractor and the other Contractor have the same name and location.

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns a hashcode for this Contractor object that should be reasonably unique amongst Contractor objects. As with the equals method, we know that the name and location combination will be unique amongst Contractor records, so all we need do is return the name and location combination hashcode.

Overrides:
hashCode in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
the hashcode for this instance of Contractor.

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of the Contractor class.

Overrides:

Returns:
contractor String representation of the Contractor class.
